summary: The Women's Protection in Telehealth Act (H.R. 1349) aims to amend title XI of the Social Security Act to exclude providers of certain abortion services from participating in the Medicare program. It defines "abortion-inducing drug" and sets conditions for its provision, including requiring a physician, physical examination, in-person presence, and a follow-up visit. The bill also specifies the terms of exclusion and removes certain provisions related to exclusions.
